meanings.definition: To separate or disconnect a joint.
meanings.sent1: I had to unjoint the pieces to fix the broken chair.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic needed to unjoint the engine to access the faulty part.
meanings.sent3: Trying to unjoint the stubborn puzzle pieces was like solving a mystery.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to unjoint his body parts and put them back together.
meanings.sent5: The old house creaked as if it could unjoint itself at any moment.

meanings.sent1: The unjoint pieces of the puzzle made it impossible to complete.
meanings.sent2: The unjoint sections of the train track caused delays in the schedule.
meanings.sent3: The unjoint links in the chain rattled noisily as they moved.
meanings.sent4: The unjoint bridge swayed dangerously in the strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The unjoint branches of the tree created a unique silhouette against the sky.
